data.title: Cheryl Fernandez-Versini Divorce: Star To Keep Husband Jean-Bernard's Surname, Following Split?
data.meta_description: Cheryl To Retain Married Name Following Split?
data.text:
Cheryl Fernandez-Versini is planning to keep her married name after her divorce from husband Jean-Bernard, it has been claimed.

READ MORE:

There'll Be No Girls Aloud Reunion At Kimberley's Wedding

Sarah Harding Gives Her Verdict On Cheryl's Split

Cheryl's Husband Breaks Online Silence Following Divorce Reports

The ‘Call My Name’ singer is reportedly about to end her marriage with the French restaurateur, just 15 months after tying the knot.

Advertisement

However, it has now been suggested she will keep his name rather than reverting back to her maiden name ‘Tweedy’ or previous surname ‘Cole’, with The Sun claiming she feels it is more in keeping with her life in 2016.

Cheryl Fernandez-Versini

An insider told the newspaper: “Cheryl has had to reinvent herself several times but her three past names all have very different memories.

“Tweedy is associated with her assault court case, Cole with [ex-husband] Ashley’s cheating and now her new name with another failed marriage.”

Advertisement

After splitting with footballer Ashley Cole in 2010, Cheryl retained her married name, claiming at the time that changing it back would make it appear that she was “ashamed” of the marriage.

She later changed her name professionally to simply Cheryl, which her last two albums, ‘A Million Lights’ and ‘Only Human’ were released under.

Following weeks of speculation about of her marriage, various reports last week claimed that the pair were planning to divorce.

Although Cheryl is yet to acknowledge the rumours, she has since made several public appearances, including at the hen night of former Girls Aloud bandmate, Kimberley Walsh.
